name: 1-brian-lozada-on-high-velocity-leadership
headline: High Velocity Leadership
subHeadline: A conversation with Brian Lozada, former CISO, ZocDocs
description:
We talk with Brian Lozada, former CISO, ZocDocs, about his experience scaling with velocity in the cloud, building an infastructure as code culture and security risk and compliance.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 10-leadership-diversity-learning-to-fail-and-balancing-technolog‪y
headline: Leadership, Diversity, Learning to Fail, and Balancing Technolog‪y
subHeadline: A conversation with Shaown Nandi, former CIO, Dow Jones
description:
Shaown Nandi, former CIO at Dow Jones, dives into how he and his team identify, develop, and inspire new leaders, the importance of diversity at Dow Jones, and his approach to encouraging mentorship. Shaown also explains why learning to fail keeps the business and employees on the forefront of new technology - as long as you fail in a smart way.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 100-rapidly-scaling-business-transformation
headline: Rapidly Scaling Business Transformation
subHeadline: A conversation with Rita Fisher, CIO & EVP of Supply Chain, Reynolds Consumer Products
description:
Companies on the path to digital business transformation often lack an agile platform to enable this process or require a compelling event to force acceleration. Reynolds Consumer Products had the platform and the compelling event to accelerate their transformation within a year. The company fully migrated to AWS, implementing a brand-new instance of SAP on AWS, an entire data center exit, and modernization of their factory floor. Join this session to learn how Rita Fisher, CIO and EVP of Supply Chain at Reynolds Consumer Products, took bold moves, measured risk, and enabled agility as part of her strategic road map.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 101-scaling-sustainability-innovation
headline: Scaling Sustainability Innovation
subHeadline: A conversation with Ruth Gratzke, President of Siemens Smart Infrastructure U.S. and CEO of Siemens Industry Inc.
description:
Companies across all industries have set ambitious goals to reduce the environmental impact of their operations and work towards a net zero carbon future. Achieving these goals requires collaboration across an organization, from senior executives to leaders who execute sustainability initiatives relevant to their area of the business. To accelerate progress, leaders need to align business and technical teams and build the scalable solutions required to accurately measure and report on sustainability programs, and continuously improve performance. Join Chris Wellise, AWS Sustainability Director, and Ruth Gratzke, President of Siemens Smart Infrastructure U.S. and CEO of Siemens Industry, Inc.to hear how AWS and Siemens are utilizing technology to integrate sustainability into their infrastructure and operations, as well as helping customers and partners deploy solutions to achieve their sustainability goals.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 102-designing-a-cloud-enabled-workforce
headline: Designing a Cloud-Enabled Workforce
subHeadline: Conversations with Prakash Kota, CIO at Autodesk
description:
Digital transformation is challenging how business leaders need to think about the future of work, the design of organizational structures, and the new skills and competencies required to win in the digital future. Join this candid conversation with Prakash Kota, CIO at Autodesk about organizational strategies and best practices to empower your people and business to succeed in the digital future.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 103-science-and-cloud-technology
headline: Science & Cloud Technology
subHeadline: A conversation with Robyne Teslich, Deputy CIO for Cloud Transformation, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory
description:
Robyne Teslich, the Deputy Chief Information Officer for Cloud Transformation at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, sits down with us to talk about the complexities of migrating to the cloud and the added complexity of contracts with the public sector. Hear Robyne talk about why leaders should embrace cloud transformation and her approach to changes at a massive scale.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 104-hsbc-wealth-and-personal-banking-agile-transformation-journey
headline: HSBC Wealth and Personal Banking’s Agile Transformation Journey
subHeadline: A conversation with Gavin Munroe, WPB Global CIO, HSBC
description:
Companies that lack the necessary support for change from leadership can sometimes fail in their digital transformations. Collaboration between the CIO and other business leaders is critical to the development of a successful business strategy powered by technology. Leaders need to look for opportunities to support and accelerate digital literacy across the organization and to work cross-functionally with business partners to define what digital means for their organizations. Hear from Gavin Munroe, WPB Global CIO of HSBC, for a candid discussion of strategies, tactics, and common pitfalls to avoid as you create your plan, build your narrative, and engage your stakeholders to drive progress through digital transformation.

Listen the podcast

name: 105-understanding-and-protecting-data
headline: Understanding and Protecting Data
subHeadline: A conversation with Jack Berkowitz, the Chief Data Officer at ADP
description:
In this Spotlight, Jack Berkowitz, the Chief Data Officer at ADP discusses the importance of unlocking data silos to share and understand information while still protecting the client’s privacy. We will then shift gears to share the secrets of how ADP evaluates data to know if a company is genuinely seeking diversity, equity, and inclusion. We will conclude with a section devoted to why the pivot to the cloud added the pace and framework to accelerate their business.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcast

name: 106-extending-security-ownership-across-your-organization
headline: 106: Extending Security Ownership Across Your Organization
subHeadline: Megan O’Neil, Principal Security Solutions Architect at AWS
description:
As a Principal Solutions Architect specializing in security, identity, and compliance at AWS, Megan O’Neil is passionate about helping customers refine their cloud security strategy. She provides education and advice to help customers build their security foundation, set appropriate guardrails, implement security controls, and define their best operating model for cloud.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcast

name: 107-reframing-security-as-a-strategic-advantage
headline: 107: Reframing Security as a Strategic Advantage
subHeadline: A conversation with Merritt Baer, Principal in the Office of the CISO at AWS
description:
While some may see security as a stumbling block to digital transformation, Merritt Baer sees it as a business enabler. As a Principal in the AWS Office of the CISO, Merritt knows security isn’t just about how an organization secures itself, but also how it delivers secure products and services for customers. She helps leaders see the value of security in their organizations and helps reinforce our own culture of security here at AWS.

Listen podcast

name: 108-rethinking-security-and-compliance-operations-at-aws
headline: 108: Rethinking Security and Compliance Operations at AWS
subHeadline: A conversation with Chad Woolf, VP of AWS Security
description:
Hear from Chad Woolf, VP of AWS Security, on how AWS is constantly reinventing its security and compliance teams and processes to meet the demands of such a fast-growing and ever-changing world.

Listen podcast

name: 109-leading-a-full-enterprise-digital-transformation
headline: 109: Leading a Full Enterprise Digital Transformation
subHeadline: A conversation with Shaun Braun, the SVP of Digital Transformation at 3M
description:
In this Spotlight, Shaun Braun, 3M’s senior vice president of digital transformation shares the framework used to drive decision-making across the entire enterprise in leading the 120-year-old company into the digital era.

Listen podcast

name: 11-potential-of-voice-technologies-and-the-cloud
headline: Potential of Voice Technologies and the Cloud (Part 1 of 3)
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Webster, Director of Product, Adobe
description:
In part 1 of a 3 part series, Mark Webster, Director of Product at Adobe, talks about how the Cloud and Voice Technology is changing design and workflow at Adobe, and the overall impact of voice on the end user.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 110-c-suite-strategies-for-leading-significant-change
headline: 110: C-Suite Strategies for Leading Significant Change
subHeadline: A conversation with Jonathan Allen, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS Ishit Vachhrajani, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS Clarke Rodgers, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS
description:
While cloud adoption may bring speed and agility into the business growth equation, there are also numerous risks and challenges that must be addressed. Balancing momentum and disruption is an ongoing struggle for executives attempting to transform their companies. Hear from three seasoned AWS enterprise strategists who have successfully led organizations through change as they share their experiences and strategies to help organizations navigate their cloud transformation journeys.

Listen podcast

name: 111-creative-workforce-solutions-to-close-the-gap-in-tech-talent
headline: 111: Creative Workforce Solutions to Close the Gap in Tech Talent
subHeadline: A conversation with Jonathan Allen, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS, Ishit Vachhrajani, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS, Clarke Rodgers, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS
description:
Cutting-edge tools and technology without the right talent have little value. The engineer skillset must change as rapidly as the technology in order to remain relevant. Building a culture of innovation and creating an environment that provides growth for individuals and teams is crucial to successful transformation. Hear from three seasoned AWS executives who have successfully built and led technology teams as they share their experiences and strategies to help organizations navigate their cloud transformation journeys.

Listen to Podcast

name: 112-leading-your-enterprise-in-an-economic-downturn
headline: 112: Leading Your Enterprise in an Economic Downturn
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Schwartz, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS, Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS, Chris Hennesey, Finance Strategist, AWS
description:
Economic downturns, like many crises, can present a false dichotomy for leaders wanting to undergo a digital transformation: cut costs, or invest in becoming an agile organization that can weather future disruption? Hear from three seasoned AWS Executives who have successfully built and led technology teams as they share their strategies for navigating a cloud transformation journey in rough economic headwinds and beyond. 

Listen Podcast

name: 113-weathering-disruptions-with-a-culture-of-trust
headline: 113: Weathering Disruptions with a Culture of Trust
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Schwartz, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS Chris Hennesey, Finance Strategist, AWS
description:
Economic downturns, supply chain issues, global pandemics, disruptive geo-politics: there are innumerable crises your organization will face throughout its lifetime. These crises can be a forcing function for transformation, but how to you motivate your talent to get (and stay) onboard? Hear from three AWS leaders as they discuss how to build a culture of trust that will weather-proof your organization from future, unknowable storms. 

Listen Podcast

name: 114-future-proofing-is-a-flawed-concept
headline: 114: Future-Proofing is a Flawed Concept
subHeadline: A conversation with Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS and Gregor Hohpe, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
Can enterprises ever truly "future-proof" their organization? Predictions have become less and less reliable, and five year plans less realistic. How can leaders keep their organizations nimble and responsive to whatever comes, while also being intentional about growth and resource allocation? Join two AWS leaders as they discuss how to think about "future-readiness" as an alternative framework.

Listen Podcast

name: 115-fomo-in-the-c-suite
headline: 115: FOMO in the C-Suite
subHeadline: A conversation with Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS and Gregor Hohpe, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
Does your leadership team suffer from the "fear of missing out" on the next technological advancement, leading to impulsive decisions or strategy shifts? How can you evaluate an innovative new offering to determine if it will create actual value for your organization? In this episode, AWS leaders tackle long and short-term planning, talent development, digital transformation, and more tools to help Executives avoid "FOMO".

Listen Podcast

name: 116-banking-on-the-future-innovation-and-culture-change-in-a-risk-averse-industry
headline: 116: Banking on the future: Innovation and culture change in a risk-averse industry
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Holt, CTO at 10x Banking
description:
How do you drive organizational and even cultural change in boardrooms and entire businesses to make digital transformation a success? What does that look like in the fast-moving world of banking, where huge highly-regulated incumbents are battling nimble fintech start-ups who were born in the cloud? In this episode of AWS Conversations with Leaders, Mark Holt, CTO of 10x Banking shares his insight about how to make a success of transformation, and the big shifts in mindset needed to get there.

Listen Podcast

name: 117-a-cisos-guide-to-establishing-and-scaling-security-culture
headline: 117: A CISO’s Guide to Establishing and Scaling Security Culture
subHeadline: A conversation with Clarke Rodgers, director of AWS enterprise strategy and Amazon’s chief security officer, Steve Schmidt
description:
In this episode of Conversations With Leaders, we're focusing on security as a critical component of digital transformation. Join Clarke Rodgers, director of AWS enterprise strategy as he interviews amazon’s chief security officer, Steve Schmidt about what it takes to establish a security culture, scale securely, and continuously adapt to changing circumstances.

Listen Podcast

name: 118-the-human-impact-of-government-modernization
headline: 118: The Human Impact of Government Modernization
subHeadline: A conversation with Mike Beaven, Senior Manager of Government Transformation at AWS, and Sarah Ryle from the AWS Institute
description:
In this episode of Conversations With Leaders, we’re talking about the human side of digital transformation in government. Join Sarah Ryle from the AWS Institute as she speaks with Mike Beaven, Senior Manager of Government Transformation at AWS, about the impact that government service modernization can have on the everyday lives of citizens. 

Listen Podcast

name: 119-making-security-personal-for-public-sector
headline: 119: Making Security Personal for Public Sector
subHeadline: A conversation with Liam Maxwell, Director of Digital Government Transformation at AWS, Alex Meek-Holmes, Senior Manager of Government Transformation at AWS, and Sarah Ryle of the AWS institute
description:
Join Sarah Ryle of the AWS institute as she interviews Liam Maxwell, Director of Digital Government Transformation at AWS, and Alex Meek-Holmes, Senior Manager of Government Transformation at AWS about the intricacies of security in the public sector.

Listen Podcast

name: 12-voice-technology-and-the-impact-on-the-business
headline: Voice Technology and the Impact on the Business (Part 2 of 3)
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Webster, Director of Product, Adobe
description:
Mark is back to discuss the potential business impacts of voice technologies. He explains how the AWS Cloud and Amazon Alexa are enabling employees, increasing the reliability of systems, and creating new capabilities for UX designers.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 120-succeeding-in-economies-of-speed-rethinking-your-levers-part-1
headline: 120: Succeeding in Economies of Speed: Rethinking Your Levers, Part 1
subHeadline: Conversations with Miriam McLemore, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
When leaders look to change their organization, they often begin with restructuring, defining new processes and guidelines, or granting exceptions to innovation units. However, transformation isn’t just about doing existing things better; it’s foremost about doing things differently. This session by Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore from AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas highlights why transformation is different from any other project and challenges leaders to rethink their levers for change. 

Listen Podcast

name: 121-succeeding-in-economies-of-speed-rethinking-your-levers-part-2
headline: 121: Succeeding in Economies of Speed: Rethinking Your Levers, Part 2
subHeadline: Conversation with Miriam McLemore, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
In Part 2 of this re:Invent Las Vegas session, Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore highlights why transformation is different from any other project and challenges leaders to rethink their levers for change. Learn more about how finding the intersection between innovation and operational excellence can deliver value and results. 

Listen Podcast

name: 122-aws-cloud-security-how-it-started-where-it-is-headed
headline: 122: AWS Cloud Security — How it Started, Where It’s Headed
subHeadline: Conversation with CJ Moses, Chief Information Security Officer at AWS, and Clarke Rodgers, director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
Discover what it takes to build a security organization from the ground up and design a security culture supported by innovative hiring practices. You'll hear all this and more in this discussion between CJ Moses, Chief Information Security Officer at AWS, and Clarke Rodgers, director of AWS Enterprise Strategy.

Listen Podcast

name: 123-whats-next-in-reinventing-aviation
headline: 123: What's Next in Reinventing Aviation?
subHeadline: Conversation with Eddie Wilson, CEO of Ryanair, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA
description:
How do you continuously innovate for customers in a heavily regulated industry like aviation, especially when you're coming out of some of the most difficult years the industry has experienced? And how do you stay resilient not just to survive, but thrive through challenging times? Eddie Wilson, CEO of Ryanair, joins Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA, to discuss controlling your organization's destiny through constant simplification, efficiency strategies, and scaling operational improvements.

Listen to the podcast

name: 124-accelerating-government-procurement-through-digital-transformation
headline: 124: Accelerating Government Procurement Through Digital Transformation
subHeadline: Conversation with Sarah Ryle, AWS Institute, Liam Maxwell, AWS Director of Government Transformation, and Warren Smith, Associate Director at Curshaw
description:
In this public sector themed episode, we discuss how (and why) government agencies should modernize their procurement processes.

Listen to the podcast

name: 125-think-like-an-auditor-how-to-measure-security-compliance
headline: #125: Think Like an Auditor: How to Measure Security Compliance
subHeadline: Conversation with Samara Moore, AWS Senior Manager of Security Assurance, and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
If you’ve ever wondered how to measure your security compliance like an auditor would, this is the conversation for you. Hear from Samara Moore, Senior Manager of Security Assurance at AWS and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy, as they discuss best practices around security compliance and regulations.

Listen to the podcast

name: 126-the-unipart-way-how-chairman-and-group-chief-executive-john-neill-is-building-the-worlds-best-company
headline: #126: The Unipart Way: How Chairman & Group Chief Executive John Neill is Building "the World's Best Company"
subHeadline: Conversation with John Neill, Chairman and Group Chief Executive of Unipart, and Tanuja Randery, AWS EMEA Managing Director
description:
How do you respond to difficult times when the situation is too complex to solve from the top down? John Neill, Chairman & Group Chief Executive of Unipart, joins Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA, to discuss the process, culture, and digital solutions involved in building "the world's best company" even in the face of unprecedented difficulty.

Listen to the podcast

name: 127-how-citizens-help-governments-build-better-it-service
headline: #127: How Citizens Help Governments Build Better IT Services
subHeadline: Conversation with Sarah Ryle, AWS Institute, Liam Maxwell, AWS Director of Government Transformation, and Mike Beaven, AWS Senior Manager of Government Transformation
description:
Discover best practices for IT change management in the government space in this episode hosted by Sarah Ryle of the AWS Institute. You'll hear from Liam Maxwell, Director of Government Transformation at AWS, and Mike Beaven, Senior Manager of Government Transformation at AWS about government change management and how working directly with citizens can help leaders build better, stronger services.

Listen to the podcast

name: 128-advice-for-cisos-from-aws-ciso-cj-moses
headline: #128: Advice for CISOs from AWS CISO CJ Moses
subHeadline: A conversation with CJ Moses, AWS CISO and VP of Security Engineering
description:
If you've ever wondered what it takes to become a successful CISO, this episode is for you. We've caught up with AWS CISO CJ Moses to ask him what advice he has for other security leaders around the globe. After 15 years in security leadership at AWS, CJ has plenty of guidance to share.

Listen to the podcast

name: 129-how-ceo-chris-hill-is-personalizing-at-scale
headline: #129: How Chris Hill is Personalizing at Scale
subHeadline: A conversation with Chris Hill, CEO of Hargreaves Lansdown, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA
description:
How can an enterprise support customers as their industry grows from $3 to $4 trillion in just a few years? Join Chris Hill, CEO of Hargreaves Lansdown, the UK's largest digital wealth management service, as he discusses automation, personalization, and digital transformation at scale with Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA.

Listen to the podcast

name: 13-leadership-and-lessons-learned
headline: Leadership and Lessons Learned (Part 3 of 3)
subHeadline: A conversation with Mark Webster, Director of Product, Adobe
description:
In the final episode of our 3 part series, Mark shares the lessons he's learned, top challenges he faces as a leader, and how he keeps his team moving forward in a constantly changing environment.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 130-how-to-pass-your-compliance-audit-with-aws
headline: #130: How to Pass Your Compliance Audit with AWS
subHeadline: A conversation with Jessie Skibbe, Senior Practice Manager of AWS Security Assurance, and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
In today's conversation with Jessie Skibbe, Senior Practice Manager of AWS Security Assurance, we're covering the odds and ends of security compliance. Discover how AWS came to be a Qualified Security Assessor and what that means for customers seeking compliance advice and guidance on how to pass an audit.

Listen to the podcast

name: 131-learning-at-the-speed-of-cloud-turning-employees-into-entrepreneurs-part-1
headline: #131: Learning at the Speed of Cloud: Turning Employees into Entrepreneurs (Part 1)
subHeadline: A conversation with Phil Le-Brun, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
Unlocking your organization's potential for rapid innovation is one of the key benefits of leveraging the cloud. But how can you effectively harness this potential by cultivating essential skills at every level, starting from the top leadership down? This session by Enterprise Strategist Phil Le-Brun from AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas highlights patterns and approaches that can help you create the time and momentum to reskill your entire organization so you can capitalize on the potential of the cloud.

Listen to the podcast

name: 132-learning-at-the-speed-of-cloud-turning-employees-into-entrepreneurs-part-2
headline: #132: Learning at the Speed of Cloud: Turning Employees into Entrepreneurs (Part 2)
subHeadline: A conversation with Phil Le-Brun, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
In Part 2 of this re:Invent Las Vegas session, Enterprise Strategist Phil Le-Brun highlights patterns and approaches that can help you create the time and momentum to reskill your entire organization so you can capitalize on the potential of the cloud. Listen to Part 1 in yesterday's episode.

Listen to the podcast

name: 133-generative-ai-and-a-culture-of-innovation-in-capital-markets
headline: #133: Generative AI and a Culture of Innovation in Capital Markets | Dr. Matthias Voelkel, CEO Boerse Stuttgart Group
subHeadline: A conversation with Dr. Matthias Voelkel, CEO of Boerse Stuttgart Group, and Tanuja Randery, AWS EMEA Managing Director
description:
Join Dr. Matthias Voelkel, CEO Boerse Stuttgart Group, one of Europe's leading stock exchanges, in conversation with with Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA, to delve into the transformative power of generative AI and its impact on the capital markets. Our guest shares insights on how his organization has maintained a culture of innovation and risk-taking while balancing a 160 year legacy, and on what digital trends he's seeing in the industry.

Listen to the podcast

name: 134-data-trust-the-most-essential-ingredient-for-ai-innovation
headline: #134: Data Trust: The Most Essential Ingredient for AI Innovation
subHeadline: A conversation with Chris McCurdy and Dimple Ahluwalia of IBM Security along with Clarke Rodgers, AWS Director of Enterprise Strategy
description:
In this special episode, we welcome Chris McCurdy and Dimple Ahluwalia of IBM Security to the show. They’ll be talking with AWS security expert, Clarke Rodgers about our joint research report titled, “Data Security as Business Accelerator?” Hear directly from the authors themselves about how trusted data is driving competitive advantage for companies today and why it's the key ingredient to AI innovation.

Listen to the podcast

name: 135-how-technology-leaders-can-prepare-for-generative-ai
headline: #135: How Technology Leaders Can Prepare for Generative AI
description:
The potential of generative AI for every industry is huge. From upskilling workforce to getting data foundations right, hear tips from AWS Enterprise Strategist Phil Le-Brun about how technology leaders can best prepare their organizations for what generative AI will bring.

Listen to the podcast

name: 136-invention-vs-innovation-with-benedetto-vigna-ceo-of-ferrari-part-one
headline: #136: Invention vs Innovation with Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, Part 1
subHeadline: A conversation with Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA
description:
Join Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, for Part 1 of a conversation with Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA, as they discuss driving innovation, sustainability, and a focus on customer experience. Our guest also gives insights into his personal leadership style (and reading list), and how he decreases Ferrari's BMI...Bureaucratic Mass Index. Stay tuned for Part 2 tomorrow.

Listen now

name: 137-invention-vs-innovation-with-benedetto-vigna-ceo-of-ferrari-part-two
headline: #137: Invention vs Innovation with Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, Part 2
subHeadline: A conversation with Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA
description:
Listen to Part 2 of the conversation with Benedetto Vigna, CEO of Ferrari, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA, as they discuss driving innovation, sustainability, and a focus on customer experience. Benedetto also shares his role in Ferrari's digital transformation journey, and dives deep into the company's new green collection. Be sure to listen to Part 1, published yesterday.

Listen now

name: 138-maximizing-the-roi-of-a-cloud-transformation
headline: #138: Maximizing the ROI of a Cloud Transformation
subHeadline: A conversation with Chhavi Arora, McKinsey Partner, Jonathan Allen, AWS Enterprise Strategist, and Tom Adams, General Manager for Business Consulting and Advisory Partners, AWS
description:
How can executive leaders ensure ROI for their cloud transformation, scale adoption, and drive business value? Join AWS Enterprise Strategist Jonathan Allen, McKinsey Partner Chhavi Arora, and General Manager for Business Consulting and Advisory Partners at AWS Tom Adams as they share insights on getting the most out of your organization's digital transformation.

Listen now

name: 139-who-owns-what-security-ownership-and-responsibility-at-aws
headline: #139: Who Owns What? Security Ownership and Responsibility at AWS
subHeadline: A conversation with Laura Grit, AWS Distinguished Engineer and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
When it comes to security management, how clear is the line of ownership in your organization? When patching needs to happen fast, will your employees know who’s responsible for what? That’s what we’re discussing with Laura Grit, AWS Distinguished Engineer and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy. Join us to learn how the security ownership model works at AWS.

Listen now

name: 14-from-the-floor-of-executive-summit-at-aws-re-invent-part-1
headline: From the Floor of Executive Summit at AWS re:Invent 2019 (Part 1 of 3)
subHeadline: A conversation with Alison Robinson and Michael Berman from top California universities
description:
Listen in to part 1 of 3, where we hear from Alison Robinson and Michael Berman - two leaders from top California universities - on their experiences and key takeaways from Executive Summit at AWS re:Invent.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 140-transforming-smbs-with-cloud-based-financial-solutions
headline: #140: Transforming SMBs with Cloud-Based Financial Solutions
subHeadline: A conversation with Nathan Gill, Chief Product Officer of EposNow, and Chris Hennesey, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
Join Chief Product Officer of EposNow Nathan Gill and AWS Enterprise Strategist Chris Hennesey as they dive deep into the challenges facing small-to-medium businesses across the globe, and how EposNow is using technology to help SMBs overcome those challenges and scale their efforts.

Listen now

name: 141-no-such-thing-as-done-the-role-of-security-in-product-development
headline: #141: No Such Thing as "Done" - The Role of Security in Product Development
subHeadline: A conversation with Bill Shinn, AWS Senior Principal in the Office of the CISO, and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
According to Bill Shinn, AWS Senior Principal in the Office of the CISO, security isn’t “done” just because a project ends or a service gets launched. Listen in as Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy chats with Bill about how to ensure your products and services stay secure before and after launch.

Listen now

name: 142-vulnerability-management-in-a-zero-day-security-scenario
headline: #142: Vulnerability Management in a Zero Day Security Scenario
subHeadline: A conversation with CJ Moses, Chief Information Security Officer at AWS and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy
description:
In this Security Leaders conversation, we’re catching up with CJ Moses, Chief Information Security Officer at AWS, on the topic of vulnerability management. Join CJ and Clarke Rodgers, Director of AWS Enterprise Strategy, as they discuss basic cyber-defense strategies that have enormous impact.

Listen now

name: 143-how-leaders-create-a-multiplier-effect-with-leila-fourie-group-ceo-of-the-johannesburg-stock-exchange
headline: #143: How Leaders Create a Multiplier Effect with Leila Fourie, Group CEO of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange
subHeadline: A conversation with Leila Fourie, Group CEO of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, and Tanuja Randery, Managing Director, AWS EMEA
description:
In this episode, Tanuja Randery, Managing Director of AWS for Europe, Middle East, and Africa, sits down with Leila Fourie, Group CEO of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, to delve into the transformative power of gender equality, technological innovation, and democratizing access to data. Fourie shares her insights on fostering inclusive leadership, the vital role of technology in driving growth, and the JSE's pioneering initiatives, from the Trade Explorer to AI-driven social listening. Discover how leadership, confidence, and a culture of continuous learning drive success in a rapidly evolving business landscape.

Listen now

name: 144-transforming-customer-service-with-ai
headline: #144: Transforming Customer Service with AI
subHeadline: A conversation with Cristina Fonseca, VP of Product in charge of AI/ML at Zendesk, and Jake Burns, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
In this episode, Jake Burns, AWS Enterprise Strategist, and Cristina Fonseca, VP of Product in charge of AI/ML at Zendesk, share insights on the optimal implementation of AI in customer experience, underscoring the importance of striking a balance between automation and human interaction. Cristina explores the potential of AI to elevate customer journeys, from refined searches to personalized responses, while prioritizing human assistance for intricate cases. The episode delves into AI's transformative prowess across diverse industries and underscores the collaborative synergy between human ingenuity and technological advancements, steering AI towards positive impact.

Join AWS Enterprise Strategist Tom Soderstrom, Infosys Knowledge Institute Chief Learner and Sharer Jeff Kavanaugh, and Principal Specialist of Machine Learning at AWS Ilan Gleiser as they delve into practical advice for exploring renewable energy sources and offsetting carbon emissions. They emphasize the importance of a systems-thinking approach and the role of technology, such as AI/ML, in driving sustainability efforts. The episode also touches on real-world examples of positive impact on both business and the environment, such as circular economy initiatives, and includes advice for calculating impact metrics.

They emphasize the importance of strong data foundations and responsible AI practices, urging leaders to harness the power of generative AI for value-driven outcomes. Learn how generative AI can enhance customer operations, sales, marketing, R&D, and software development, and discover how to navigate the journey of transformation with your entire organization.

name: 3-capabilities-to-get-more-value-out-of-your-data
headline: 3 capabilities to get more value out of your data
subHeadline: Learn how BMW, Nasdaq, and BP are implementing an end-to-end data strategy to drive business outcomes.
description: Across industries and enterprises, data continues to explode, increasing in volume, variety, and velocity. According to IDC estimates, 64.2 zettabytes of data was created or replicated in 2020, and the amount of digital data created from 2021-2025 will be more than twice the amount of data created since the advent of digital storage. Internet of things (IoT) data is the fastest growing segment, followed by social media and video. Given that one zettabyte is the equivalent of about 250 billion DVDs, it’s understandable that enterprises are struggling to keep up.

description: In the digital age, customers expect seamless experiences from the brands they do business with, regardless of where or how they buy goods and services. Customers gravitate to personalized interactions and show a preference for companies that anticipate and cater to their unmet needs.

name: 3-ways-computer-vision-and-iot-can-transform-operations
headline: 3 Ways Computer Vision and IoT Can Transform Operations
subHeadline: Overcome price increases and labor shortages with digital innovation.
description: “Industry 4.0” may sound like a buzz phrase, but the operations transformation taking place is real. As our manufacturing customers face rising materials and energy prices, labor shortages, and ambitious sustainability goals, I’m increasingly talking to them about using data with machine learning (ML) to completely reinvent production processes for greater efficiency and quality. Our manufacturing customers aren’t looking for incremental shifts; they want step-change improvements. And they want to transform their operations with cost-effective technologies that are easy to implement. With the cloud, they can do that.

The survey of 500 enterprise decision-makers found that CFM doesn’t just lower IT costs—enterprises that adopted CFM practices also saw increased revenue, operational resilience, profitability, and staff productivity.

subHeadline: A conversation with Barbara Salami, VP of Digital, Moderna
description:
Despite massive investments, building and maintaining the capacity to innovate remains a frustrating pursuit for many. Many organizations rely on previously successful ideas, processes, and business models. However, those strategies may not consider necessary business changes due to digital technologies. The future of product development and business model reinvention requires a new focus—re-envisioning products and processes, working backwards from the customer, and questioning established thinking to overcome innovation stalemates. Join this session for a conversation with Barbara Salami, VP of Digital at Moderna, about how digital technologies are changing business models and best practices to accelerate growth through product innovation.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 98-driving-cloud-transformation-and-customer-trust
headline: Driving Cloud Transformation and Customer Trust
subHeadline: A conversation with Julia Houston, CMO of Equifax
description:
Julia Houston, the CMO of Equifax, shares what she learned in her journey, from managing the response to Equifax’s 2017 data breach, getting all stakeholders on board with the cloud investment, and earning customer trust through built-in data security.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: 99-combining-cloud-and-culture-change-for-company-sustainability
headline: Combining Cloud and Culture Change for Company Sustainability

description:
Bryson Koehler, the CTO of Equifax, sits down with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore to talk about Equifax’s decision to go cloud-native. He discusses “baking security in” rather than “bolting it on at the end” of the process, building trust with customers and working with them to leverage the changes, and the incredible increase in the speed of innovation and launching of new products the cloud has enabled.

Listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts

name: a-10-step-plan-for-talent-transformation
headline: A 10 Step Action Plan for Talent Transformation
subHeadline: It will cost you less than you think to reskill and scale up your current staff
description:
One of the top concerns around migrating to the cloud is whether your existing teams have the skills needed to make it happen. The answer is simple: yes, they can—with the right training. In fact, research shows that it's less expensive to reskill and scale up your current staff than it is to hire new teams. Not only that, organizations that are comprehensively trained adopt cloud 80% faster on average. This infographic provides a quick snapshot of the steps you can take to set your teams up to succeed.

Read more »

name: ai-and-collaboration-a-human-angle-mark-schwartz-blog
headline: AI and Collaboration: A Human Angle
description:
I wonder if we’re overlooking an important implication of AI and generative AI for the future of the enterprise. If, as seems to be the case, many employees will use generative AI applications to assist them and interactively support their work, then a new style of work is emerging. Success for an employee will mean making the most of the AI tools with which they collaborate. We will want to hire employees who are especially good at working interactively with AI (remember how the ability to use word processors and spreadsheet applications were qualifications for a job in the old days?). We will design employee roles to maximize the benefit of collaboration with AI tools. Remote work and the gig economy have already dramatically changed the nature of work; generative AI is another potential disruption on the horizon.

Read the full blog

name: artificial-intelligence-and-machine-learning-now-is-the-time-to-invest-in-skilling-your-workforce
headline: AI and ML: Now is the Time to Invest in Skilling Your Workforce
subHeadline: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at AWS
description:
As customers increasingly adopt artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies to gain a competitive edge in the digital economy, the need for cloud expertise is on the rise. The ability to effectively leverage these technologies to drive decision-making and gain insights is becoming critical for success. According to Accenture, “this means both building talent in technical competencies like AI engineering and enterprise architecture, and training people across the organization to work effectively with AI-infused processes." However, the supply of skilled workers in the cloud computing industry remains limited, creating a significant challenge for organizations looking to implement cloud projects. This shortage of skilled workers can lead to increased costs, delays in project implementation, and reduced competitiveness. To address this challenge, customers are investing in training and development programs for their existing employees.

Read the article

For example, as part of its efforts to unlock different human genomes, AstraZeneca is working toward the analysis of up to 2 million individual genomes by 2026. This initiative alone has generated an explosion in the quantity and complexity of data the company collects, stores, and analyzes for insights

description:

We are constantly thinking about our outcomes, and if we're not hitting them, it's a matter of just re-orienting. It's not about taking a risk that's so big you're going to put the company, team, or a product at risk, but it's really about taking the kind of risk that you can learn from and then build upon going forward."
