name: changing-the-face-of-movie-making
headline: Changing the Face of Moviemaking
subHeadline: Taking Hollywood blockbusters and award-winning web series postproduction to the cloud, Company 3 found new ways to collaborate globally, increase workflow efficiency, and expand its roster of diverse movie-making talent.
description: In its early days, the pandemic hit the $99 billion entertainment industry particularly hard. People staying home from movie theaters led to a precipitous drop in theatrical revenue, while demand for streaming content grew almost immediately. Subscriptions to streaming services in the U.S. jumped 14% in 2021 alone, and the digital movie market accounted for 72% of the global theatrical and home/mobile entertainment market in 2021, up from just 48% in 2019, according to the Motion Picture Association.But filling the entertainment pipeline to meet demand suddenly proved to be a major challenge.

name: blog-ciso-insight-every-aws-service-is-a-security-service
headline: CISO Insight: Every AWS Service Is a Security Service
subHeadline: by Clarke Rodgers, Enterprise Security Strategist, AWS
description:
Amazon Web Services customers have many services to contemplate, and perhaps integrate into their cloud footprint, irrespective of where they are in their cloud journey. The relentless pace of innovation continues to be one of the main attractions for customers with AWS as their cloud provider; knowing that new services and features are always coming, customers feel confident that many (if not all) of their organization’s needs can be fulfilled by one or more AWS products. Customer CISOs (or their respective teams) may want to take the time to ensure that they are well versed with all AWS services because there may be a security, risk, or compliance objective that can be met, even if a service doesn’t fall into the “Security, Identity, and Compliance” category.

Read more »

name: ciso-or-cso-which-role-defines-todays-security-leaders-best-video-page
headline: CISO or CSO? Which Role Defines Today’s Security Leaders Best?
subHeadline: A conversation with Darren Kane, CSO of NBN Co. Australia
description:
Join us for a conversation with Darren Kane, Chief Security Officer at Australia's National Broadband Network, where we explore the difference between the CISO and CSO roles and why it may be time for security leaders to “drop the I.”

Watch now

name: cloud-computing-helps-companies-weather-economic-turmoil
headline: Cloud Computing Helps Companies Weather Economic Turmoil
subHeadline: by Meredith Jones, Principal Cloud Economist, AWS
description:
The financial challenges brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic have dramatically transformed many sectors. We are seeing companies who are barely getting by and ones who are thriving. One thing is clear, cloud computing helps companies buy time – and time may be the most critical element to survival.

Read more »

name: cloud-digital-transformation-hold-key-to-sustainable-business
headline: Cloud, digital transformation hold key to sustainable business
subHeadline: Businesses are facing increasing pressure from regulators, shareholders, customers and employees to operate more sustainably, and are turning to technology and digital transformation to enable innovative ways of reducing their carbon footprint.
description: Moving corporate computing functions from on-premises servers to cloud-based AWS systems can lead to energy efficiency gains of up to five times, and a reduction in workload carbon footprint by nearly 80 percent and up to 96 percent once AWS is powered with 100 percent renewable energy—which it is on pace to meet by 2025. Those gains come in the form of greater capacity utilization, services that can be turned on and off as needed, and the fact that cloud providers like AWS typically use the most state-of-the-art, energy efficient systems and infrastructure. In a further nod to sustainability, an Amazon official said during a February call with analysts that AWS would reduce e-waste by extending the life of the servers powering its cloud systems from four years to five, and networking equipment from five years to six.

name: cloud-financial-management-maximizes-business-value-on-aws
headline: Cloud Financial Management Maximizes Business Value on Amazon Web Services
subHeadline: A study by the Hackett Group
description:
Cloud Financial Management (CFM), also known as Cloud FinOps, is the application of cloud cost management best practices and financial governance to cloud usage, to achieve the most cost-efficient business outcomes. The Hackett Group’s Cloud Services Study reveals CFM best practices that many top-performing enterprises adopt to achieve improved business outcomes.

Read More

name: cloud-financial-management-reference-guide
headline: AWS Cloud Financial Management Guide
subHeadline: by Bowen Wang, Cloud Financial Management Strategist, AWS
description:
As businesses undergo digital transformation to keep up with the ever-quickening pace of innovation customers expect, technology and finance leaders are adapting financial management processes and rethinking the way you manage technology. This guide shares Amazon Web Services (AWS) perspectives on why digital transformation requires a shift and evolution in financial management processes, how organizations can adapt, and what AWS solutions can help you succeed and manage technology as a business.

Read more »

name: cloud-for-ceos
headline: Cloud for CEOs: Measure Innovation with One Metric
subHeadline: by Adrian Cockcroft, VP Cloud Architecture Strategy, AWS
description:
Digitally transforming an enterprise requires connecting with customers, understanding their needs, and responding faster than ever. The most successful organizations of today are disrupting their competitors and entering new markets by innovating more quickly and efficiently. Being an innovator requires overcoming challenges in four areas: culture, skills, organization, and risk management. Get these right, and you will be able to leverage technologies such as cloud computing and machine learning to innovate. Adrian Cockcroft, AWS VP of Cloud Architecture Strategy, provides his perspective on unlocking growth and measuring innovation with a single metric.

Read more »

name: cloud-fueled-innovation
headline: Cloud-Fueled Innovation For Today's Manufacturers
subHeadline: Miriam McLemore, AWS Enterprise Strategist, explains how to uncover opportunities for business growth, efficiency, and operational improvement across the consumer goods and manufacturing industries.
description: For manufacturers, the last few years have been tough. Even prior to 2020, issues such as sustainability, trade conflicts, cybersecurity, and an evolving workforce were driving change across the manufacturing sector. Since the well-known upheavals of the pandemic itself, new challenges have emerged. Labor constraints, logistics issues, component shortages, rising energy costs, and geopolitical volatility are now compounding an already complex environment.

name: cloud-leadership-and-innovation-yt-S7QDotsE1As
headline: Cloud Leadership and Innovation
subHeadline: A conversation with Rob James, CIO, Qantas
description:
Rob James from Qantas shares his insights on cloud leadership and innovation.

Watch now »

name: cloud-optimization-from-the-ground-up
headline: Cloud Optimization from the Ground Up
subHeadline: The AWS Nitro System has enabled AWS to innovate for customers, delivering the best price performance while creating new instances and bringing the cloud closer to where businesses need it.
description: Cloud computing, when first introduced, relied on off-the-shelf components: hardware and software designed to support on-premises data centers, not shared resources in the cloud. Today, however, customer needs have changed dramatically. Millions of organizations, such as SmugMug, Airbnb, and Capital One, are in the cloud, and the performance and bandwidth they require continues to increase as the amount of data they process grows. In addition, customers expect faster responses today than they did only 10 years ago. In short, the traditional architecture used to initially develop the cloud could not keep up with these growing demands

name: cloud-technology-helps-scientists-save-endangered-species
headline: Cloud Technology Helps Scientists Move Faster to Save Endangered Species (RONIN)
subHeadline: Researchers at the University of Sydney are building a digitized genomic library to meet Australia’s conservation goals.
description: At the University of Sydney’s Australasian Wildlife Genomics Group, Senior Research Manager Dr. Carolyn Hogg is creating a genomic legacy database and an online tool to assist with conservation efforts and breeding programs for Australia’s threatened species. The technology is accessible to conservation managers and researchers around the world and allows Dr. Hogg’s team to manage a massive amount of data on a small research budget, focus its energy on analytics (not IT), and move with the urgency that climate change demands.

name: cloud-the-secret-sauce-for-growth-differentiation-and-productivity
headline: Cloud: the secret sauce for growth, differentiation and productivity
subHeadline: By Phil Le-Brun, AWS Enterprise Strategist and Warren Tucker, Partner at PwC
description:
As the role and influence of cloud technologies expand, we are entering a new wave of change where cloud adoption is having a greater business impact, and transforming how people live and  work. We’re seeing organisations exploit the cloud for an  increasing number of distinct but related business priorities: greater  security and resilience, improved cost efficiencies, faster innovation, development of new tech-powered services and products, and increased agility, to name a few. Cloud has become the technology reshaping commercial and operational strategies. It’s also the reason why digital-first businesses are outperforming traditional competitors in growth and profitability.

Read More

name: cloud-transformation-adobe
headline: The Cloud Transformation of Adobe
subHeadline: A Conversation with Brandon Pulsipher, Vice President of Cloud Operations at Adobe
description:
In this Spotlight, we will discuss how to leverage failure and the importance of agility and efficiency to improve the customer experience. The conversation will then shift to the power of partnership and we will conclude with Adobe’s secret to organizational transformation.

Read the article

name: collaborating-across-the-supply-chain
headline: Collaborating Across the Supply Chain
subHeadline: Reducing emissions to drive carbon reduction and empower market choice
description:
The Crop Science Division of Bayer conceptualized how to use carbon data from farms to signal the value of sustainable practices downstream through the supply chain. Bayer collaborated with Bushel, an ag-tech company, and AWS to turn the concept into a solution. Learn more about this project from Rodrigo Santos, president of Bayer Crop Science Division and Jake Joraanstad, CEO of Bushel.

Watch the video

name: connecting-the-world-of-tomorrow-today-with-5g-edge-cloud-yt-uaB3Lf7Qt7g
headline: Connecting the World of Tomorrow, Today, with 5G Edge Cloud
subHeadline: A conversation with Srinivasa Kalpala, VP Technology Strategy at Verizon and Dave Brown, VP EC2 at AWS
description:
5G is more than just mobile bandwidth for communication services providers (CSPs). By combining 5G with AWS edge cloud services, 5G improves application performance for end users in countless industries, offering up to 10 times the speed of 4G. 5G can power emerging use cases like live video event streaming, smart cars and cities, Internet of Things (IoT), and augmented reality. Learn from Srinivasa Kalpala, VP Technology Strategy, Verizon and Dave Brown, VP EC2 AWS, about how 5G cloud-native private networks are now even easier to deploy with AWS, enabling a complete Industrial 4.0 revolution.

Read more »

name: conversations-with-security-leaders
headline: Conversations with Security Leaders
subHeadline: Season 2 - all episodes now available!
description:
The Conversations with Security Leaders series is your opportunity to peek behind the curtain of AWS Security. Hear directly from AWS leaders about how we scale security and compliance across our organization and on behalf of our customers. Learn how to build security culture in your organization and discover what trends AWS leaders are predicting for the future of security.

Explore now

name: create-culture-build-business-resilience
headline: How to create a culture of learning and build business resilience
subHeadline: Cultivating a culture of continuous learning helps ensure every employee at your organization thrives. But what steps should employers take to build the optimum learning environment?
description: With cloud technology transforming every aspect of how organizations work, all employees should have a chance to learn how they can take advantage of the benefits. Moreover, improving cloud skills helps increase adoption of new systems and ensure people use them effectively. Financial services provider Absa created a Cloud Incubator initiative to support its digital transformation, and more than 4,500 employees have now received formal cloud skills training. “We did not just want to train the technical people,” says Daleen Pretorius, Head of Cloud Platforms, at Absa. “We wanted to train the tech and the non-tech people and the broader business as well.”

name: creating-a-culture-of-security
headline: Creating a Culture of Security
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
Security has become everyone’s job, and its management has become a strategic concern of the enterprise. The way forward is for the enterprise to build a culture of security. AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz describes approaches he's used to establish awareness of risks and controls along with a set of norms and practices that align with keeping the enterprise secure.

Read more »

name: creating-a-culture-of-security-yt-BRK1ziOa8MM
headline: Creating a Culture of Security
subHeadline: A conversation with Jorge O'Higgins, Directory of Cyber Security (CISO), Mercado Libre
description:
Jorge stresses the importance of engaging security teams in decisions and direction, and how autonomy and freedom can help security teams create a culture of security.

Watch now »

name: creating-an-innovation-culture
headline: Creating an Innovation Culture
subHeadline: A conversation with Darren Mowry, Managing Director, EMEA Sales (Acceleration and Expansion), AWS
description:
Darren shares some insight on our ways of working at AWS and the wider Amazon family. He details how we got to where we are by sticking to our leadership principles, keeping things agile with two-pizza teams, and always working back from the customer.

Watch now »

name: creating-supply-chain-resilience-by-building-a-digital-ecosystem
headline: Creating Supply Chain Resilience by Building a Digital Ecosystem
subHeadline: A conversation with Dave Evans, Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Fictiv
description:
Supply chain resilience became a C-level issue during the pandemic. That was fortuitous for Dave Evans, an engineer who founded Fictiv in 2013 after becoming frustrated by the long hours he spent sourcing and managing vendors while leading new product development at Ford. His answer was to create a Digital Manufacturing Ecosystem that can deliver parts 5X faster than traditional sourcing options and shift production from one location to another on a dime. Dave recently spoke on the AWS Industrial Insights podcast about how that agility benefited Fictiv’s customers amid the factory shutdowns and product shortages during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Read more »

name: cultivating-a-culture-of-innovation-and-learning-part-2-yt-mQyH4Mo3A
headline: Cultivating a Culture of Innovation and Learning
subHeadline: A conversation with Andrea Lachnik, Agility Master, and Rene Schneider, Product Owner and Cloud Expert, Deutsche Bahn Systel
description:
Andrea Lachnik, the Agility Master at Deutsche Bahn Systel, and Rene Schneider, the Product Owner and Enterprise Cloud Expert at Deutsche Bahn Systel, sit down with AWS Digital Innovation Leader Thomas Blood, to share how they are leading their organizations through rapid change. 

Watch now »

name: cultivating-security-leadership
headline: Cultivating Security Leadership
subHeadline: by Stephen Schmidt, Chief Information Security Officer, AWS
description:
The role of CISOs is to help guide the board and their peer C-suite leaders as they proactively protect their brands and customers. Today, security demands a new focus on software, and technology leaders have to be deeply involved in software development and investments. At the same time, security teams also require different skills and mindsets to succeed in new domains. AWS CISO Stephen Schmidt shares three behaviors of security leaders that recognize that security leadership is a collective pursuit. 

Read more »

name: customer-centricity-how-it-can-help-organizations-across-dach-thrive
headline: Customer-centricity: How it can help organizations across DACH thrive
subHeadline: by Klaus Bürg, Managing Director & General Manager, AWS DACH region
description:
Businesses across industries in Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH) have been challenged by reducing profit margins for some time. CEOs can unlock revenue growth by driving increasingly customer-focused cultures in their enterprises, empowered by agile technologies. Here Klaus Berg explores key challenges in the DACH region and best leadership practices for establishing lasting and profitable change, while mitigating the risks.

Read more »

They discuss how AI can augment human creativity, the importance of addressing the skills gap, and the ethical considerations surrounding AI deployment. Mark also shares leadership insights, emphasizing values-based decision-making, customer obsession, and the significance of creativity in driving business success.

subHeadline: A conversation with Chris Betz, CISO of AWS, and Clarke Rodgers, Director, Enterprise Strategy, AWS

In this episode, we're bringing you a fireside chat with Paul Vixie, AWS Deputy CISO, Vice President, and Distinguished Engineer and Clarke Rodgers, Director of Enterprise Strategy. subHeadline: A conversation with Neerav Kingsland, Head of Global Accounts for Anthropic, and Phil Le-Brun, AWS Director of Enterprise Strategy

Join host Phil Le-Brun, AWS Director of Enterprise Strategy, and Neerav Kingsland, Head of Global Accounts for Anthropic, in a conversation about Anthropic's journey to create the safest and most capable AI model in the world. In this episode, dive deep into generative AI and its potential impact on state and local governments and educational institutions. In this episode, AWS Director of Enterprise Strategy Phil LeBrun speaks with Nicole Eagan, Chief Strategy and AI Officer, and Michael Beck, Global CISO at Darktrace about how artificial intelligence is transforming cybersecurity. headline: Data Governance in the 21st-Century Organization
subHeadline: by MIT Sloan Management Review, Sponsored by AWS

Good governance requires balance and adjustment. When done well, it can fuel digital innovation without compromising security.

subHeadline: Can Data Security Accelerate Innovation?
description: New research from AWS and IBM highlights data security as a foundation for business transformation.

name: designing-a-hybrid-cloud-solution

subHeadline: How AWS improved hybrid cloud and edge cloud computing.
description: AWS hybrid cloud solutions allow customers to bring cloud infrastructure and services where needed, enabling them to quickly start using the cloud.

name: deutsche-bahn-ceo-cio-christa-koenen
headline: Infusing the Enterprise with Innovation
subHeadline: A conversation with Christa Koenen, CIO of Deutsche Bahn AG and CEO of DB Systel
description:
When Christa Koenen took over as CIO of Deutsche Bahn in 2018 in addition to her role as CEO of its internal IT business DB Systel, it was unclear to the business why anything might need to change. But what began as a question of whether the company needed to run its own data centers evolved into a plan for a massive cloud migration and retooling of the organization’s culture and processes. AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore sat down with Koenen to talk about the journey. 

Read more »

name: developing-and-measuring-a-modern-security-operations-organization
headline: Developing and Measuring a Modern Security Operations Organization
subHeadline: A conversation with Hart Rossman, Director of Global Security Practice at AWS
description:
Hart Rossman’s job is to help customers build the confidence and technical capability to operate their most sensitive workloads with AWS in the cloud. His team spends their waking hours obsessing over how to continually raise the bar for the customer experience in addressing urgent needs around security, risk and compliance.

Watch the video

name: digital-transformation-lead-with-culture-enable-with-technology
headline: Digital Transformation: Lead with Culture, Enable with Technology
subHeadline: by Phil Le-Brun, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
All too often the business value of digital transformation is not realised. One on the most common causes is that many are treated as technology projects first, rather than the business culture transformations they actually are. AWS Enterprise Strategist, Phil Le-Brun, explores three habits of successful transformation. 

Read more »

name: Discover-What’s-New-With-the-AWS-Outposts-Family
headline: Discover What’s New With the AWS Outposts Family

name: discovery-drives-innovation-scale
headline: Discovery Drives Innovation and Scale While Cutting Costs with AWS
subHeadline: By migrating its linear playout to AWS, Discovery realized substantial benefits across four areas of value.
description:
The global media industry has become increasingly dynamic. In this environment, media companies like Discovery must scale and adapt quickly and seamlessly when launching new channels, entering new markets, or acquiring other media properties.

In 2016, Discovery partnered with AWS to move its global linear playout infrastructure to the cloud to help drive agility and reduce costs.

Read the full story

name: dont-overlook-cloud-a-strategic-tool-for-cfos
headline: Don’t Overlook Cloud: A Strategic Tool for CFOs
subHeadline: by Lou Perugini, AWS Worldwide Lead, CFO and Finance Transformation
description:
The role of the CFO is expanding rapidly. Increasingly, the CFO is charged with seeking new sources of value and leading company-wide transformation. Learn how the AWS Cloud enables CFOs to increase agility, reduce risks, and accelerate digital transformation.

Read more »

name: dow-jones-vp-colleen-camuccio
headline: Diving deep
subHeadline: A conversation with  Colleen Camuccio, VP Program Management, Dow Jones
description:
Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile, and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest newsgathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.

Read more »

name: driving-change-from-the-top-down
headline: Driving Change From the Top Down
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
When it comes to digital transformation, every enterprise is different. There is often a change agent with a vision, a knowledge of good practices, a sense of urgency, and the energy to battle impediments. The change agent may be anywhere in the organizational structure: high, low, or—in a typical scenario—somewhere in middle management. AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz discusses why change that is driven from the top of the organization is a particular type of change requiring a particular approach.

Read more »

name: driving-change-through-communication-part-1-yt-OKcnHQ4mnEQ
headline: Driving Change through Communication
subHeadline: A conversation with Andrea Lachnik, Agility Master, and Rene Schneider, Product Owner and Cloud Expert, Deutsche Bahn Systel
description:
Andrea Lachnik, the Agility Master at Deutsche Bahn Systel, and Rene Schneider, the Product Owner and Enterprise Cloud Expert at Deutsche Bahn Systel, sit down with AWS Digital Innovation Leader Thomas Blood, to share how their organization has gone through a rapid migration to the AWS Cloud.

headline: Driving Growth Through Digital Transformation
subHeadline: A Chief Executive Group/AWS survey of 500 C-suite executives and public company board members
description:
A sweeping survey of more than 500 leaders at companies in nearly every industry and size category by Chief Executive Group and Amazon Web Services reveals a sizable shortfall in the organizational behaviors needed to drive business growth in the digital age—as well as huge opportunities to learn and leapfrog the competition.

name: driving-productivity
headline: Hybrid cloud and edge computing - productivity drivers
subHeadline: The cloud helps businesses of all sizes and across industries lower costs, increase productivity and accelerate innovation. But some applications need to stay on premises or at the edge to meet regulatory, speed and other requirements.
description: The cloud helps businesses of all sizes and across industries lower costs, increase productivity and accelerate innovation. But some applications need to stay on premises or at the edge to meet regulatory, speed and other requirements. As a result, many organizations rely on a hybrid of cloud, on-premises and edge solutions which can create a complex IT environment that requires developers to learn different APIs, tools, code and processes.

name: ebook-practical-sustainability-for-business
headline: Practical Sustainability for Business
subHeadline: Adopting a more holistic approach to sustainability
description:
Sustainability is a business imperative. Organizations can’t succeed when ecologies are failing or societies are degrading; in order for business to thrive, so too must the planet. Business success is inextricably tied to sustainable practices, but becoming a sustainable business doesn’t happen overnight. In this ebook, learn practical ways you can implement sustainability realistically and impactfully.

Download now

name: eight-predictions-how-technology-will-change-our-lives-in-2021
headline: Eight Predictions on How Technology Will Continue to Change Our Lives in the Coming Year
subHeadline: by Dr. Werner Vogels, Vice President and Chief Technology Officer, Amazon
description:
Businesses large and small, governments new and old all had to completely change what they do and how they operate. Helping us to manage this dramatic change was technology. Whether it was Blackboard continuing our children’s education, Zoom becoming our business boardroom (and our pub), or Netflix being our night out at the movies, we relied on technology to help feed our families, teach our children, collaborate with co-workers, even entertain ourselves after yet another day in the house. Rather than slow us down, 2020 accelerated our shift to a digital world and I anticipate we won’t go back any time soon. Thanks to this acceleration, from my vantage point, 2021 is going to be a launchpad for all kinds of change, and here are some of the areas that will be driving it. 

Read more »

name: embedding-customer-obsession-into-product-development-yt-Mn_0jZOebVo

description:

Choi describes working with AWS Digital Innovation Practice to ensure whether ‘LG Way’ was truly in place using the working backwards mechanism and the important of what this means for LG Group company executives and leaders in product planning.

description:

In this ebook, AWS Worldwide Head of EPIC Leadership and Founder of EQ at Amazon, Rich Hua, outlines the vital role emotions play in your workforce's ability to innovate, and how developing your own emotional intelligence at work can foster an increasingly innovative culture in your organization.

It touches everyone today: Earth’s billions of people, local and world governments, regulatory bodies, and notably, companies and their customers, employees, and investors, where the challenges of doing business as usual loom larger than ever.

name: encryption-built-on-the-cloud-wired-brand-lab
headline: Encryption Built on the Cloud
subHeadline: How can we create a tool that lets engineers bake an encryption earlier in the development process and make it easy?
description: Data security is top priority when building a product in its early stages, but not all software developers have expertise in it. The team at Evervault sought a solution and used AWS' Nitro Enclaves to create it. The result of this collaboration is Evervault Encryption Engine - or E3 - which provides highly constrained compute environments where sensitive data can be securely decrypted and processed. Since AWS and Nitro Enclaves are globally available on demand, Evervault easily provides affordable and secure encryption tools to developers everywhere, allowing for all software developers to ensure data security.

name: epic-games-wired-brand-lab
headline: How Epic Games and AWS Empower Users to Create the Next Great Gaming Experience
subHeadline: Fortnite from Epic Games is a free to play, always evolving multiplayer game, where anyone can collaborate to create their own world or battle to be the last one standing. But how does Epic support millions of gamers when a user-generated world goes viral?
description: Online gamers have the potential to create entire worlds - but when a surge of players join, the processing power needed for the game to run increases dramatically. Amazon EC2 helps these world-building games, like Fortnite from Epic Games, scale seamlessly so players get an uninterrupted, immersive experience with cost efficiency, allowing anyone to be the creator of the next biggest game.

name: equifax-ceo-cloud-security-leader-video

description:

In this interview with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore, he discusses the company’s decision to move its operations to the cloud, which strengthened security while simultaneously lowering costs and accelerating product delivery.

Watch the video

description:
Mark Begor was appointed CEO as the crisis was unfolding and was tasked with spearheading a recovery. In this interview with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore, he discusses the company’s decision to move its operations to the cloud, which strengthened security while simultaneously lowering costs and accelerating product delivery. He breaks down how the $1.5 billion transformation has also enabled Equifax to bring new products to market in a multi-data environment, with better uptime, giving it a strong edge over competitors.

Chief Strategy and Marketing Officer Julia Houston was at Equifax during the breach and has since played a pivotal role in managing the company’s transformation and growth. In this conversation with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore, Julia shares what she learned in her journey, from managing the response to the cyber-event, getting all stakeholders on board with the cloud investment, and earning customer trust through built-in data security.

description:
Bryson Koehler, the CTO of Equifax, sits down with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore to talk about Equifax’s decision to go cloud-native. He discusses “baking security in” rather than “bolting it on at the end” of the process, building trust with customers and working with them to leverage the changes, and the incredible increase in the speed of innovation and launching of new products the cloud has enabled.

Watch the video

name: equifax-cto-sustainability-cloud-culture

subHeadline: A Conversation with Bryson Koehler, CTO, Equifax
description:
In this conversation with AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore, Koehler, who joined the company in 2018, emphasizes that Equifax’s decision to go cloud-native was not only a technical change but a cultural one. He discusses “baking security in” rather than “bolting it on at the end” of the process, building trust with customers and working with them to leverage the changes, and the incredible increase in the speed of innovation and launching of new products the cloud has enabled.

headline: Executive Spotlight session with Teresa Carlson and Phil Le-Brun
subHeadline: A conversation with Teresa Carlson, Vice President of Worldwide Public Sector, AW‪S‬
description:
Disruption can produce chaos, making it more challenging to prioritize and take action. However, despite the challenges that governments and businesses are facing, this crisis has been the catalyst for much-needed transformation. It’s provided organisations a value- and mission driven approach to take the appropriate action to support their employees and customers. During this discussion Teresa Carlson, Vice-President of Worldwide Public Sector and Industries at AWS, will share how AWS customers are engaging partners, educating their leaders, and empowering their workforce to manage successfully in this situation and beyond.

Watch now »

name: extending-security-ownership-across-your-organization

subHeadline: A conversation with Megan O’Neil, Principal Security Solutions Architect at AWS
description:
As a Principal Solutions Architect specializing in security, identity, and compliance at AWS, Megan O’Neil is passionate about helping customers refine their cloud security strategy. She provides education and advice to help customers build their security foundation, set appropriate guardrails, implement security controls, and define their best operating model for cloud.

Watch the video

name: fighting-climate-change-with-the-cloud
headline: Fighting Climate Change with the Cloud
subHeadline: Our Climate Connections eBook shows how AWS is helping organizations tackle climate change at scale
description:
Climate change is a primary driver of numerous calamities including floods, fires, diseases, droughts, and even ecosystem collapse. These disasters pose significant risks to human health and wellbeing, especially for our most vulnerable communities. Indeed, Adam Selipsky, CEO of AWS has called climate change the issue of our generation. Yet individuals and organizations are rising to the challenge and working to monitor and forecast climate change, mitigate its impact, and find solutions. To build these solutions, people need access to the best available data, science, and technology.

Read more

name: fighting-hunger-in-UK-with-AI
headline: Using AI to Fight Hunger in the U.K.
subHeadline: Learn how AI and decision intelligence are helping manage the food supply chain and feed millions of vulnerable people.
description: FareShare Greater Manchester (GM) has forged a partnership with a technology company called Peak. Also based in Manchester, Peak specializes in Decision Intelligence, which means the company uses its cloud-based platform built on Amazon Web Services (AWS) with Intel technology to help customers apply artificial intelligence (AI) to their decision-making processes. FareShare is working with Peak to use this intelligence to match supply and demand and increase the efficiency of food redistribution.

name: first-read-your-digitalization-agenda
headline: First Read: Your Digitalization Agenda
subHeadline: by Venkat Venkatraman, Professor at Boston University and Amazon Web Services
description:
To win in this new world, you need to cultivate a new mindset—one that works back from the future, looking closely at products and processes from a customer rather than an organizational perspective, while always questioning established thinking to find ways of overcoming traps. Most of all, you need to develop a senior management team that can do all of this. How do you get there? Whether you are well on your way or just getting started, this special report by Amazon Web Services and Chief Executive Group offers a series of practical, action-oriented steps that can help you with the process of digitalizing your organization—the most important leadership challenge of our time. Part 1 of 5.

Read more »

name: flexibility-at-the-edge
headline: Hybrid cloud and edge computing - flexibility at the edge
subHeadline: Businesses across an increasing number of industries require a "cloud wherever it's needed" model to gain greater flexibility, accelerate digital transformation and innovate to increase efficiency and create differentiated products, services and end-user experiences.
description: Businesses across an increasing number of industries require a "cloud wherever it's needed" model to gain greater flexibility, accelerate digital transformation and innovate to increase efficiency and create differentiated products, services and end-user experiences. With AWS, businesses can bring the cloud closer to wherever data is generated or consumed to create a consistent and secure experience across all environments, enabling low latency and local data processing as well as compliance with data residency requirements.

subHeadline: By Maureen Lonergan, VP of Training & Certification, AWS
description:
Last year's economic challenges led organizations to reevaluate costs, prompting a need for creative solutions. Executives stressed the importance of developing individuals and fostering a culture of openness, curiosity, and continuous learning for business resilience. The outlook for this year is more optimistic, with people at the forefront of opportunities. Whether in business, HR, or technology leadership, investing in people's skills remains a strategic approach. Here are four key trends shaping organizational innovation in 2024.

name: fueling-the-future-of-sports-how-the-nfl-is-using-data-to-change-the-game-on-the-field-in-the-stands-and-in-your-home
headline: Fueling the future of sports: How the NFL is using the cloud to change the game–on the field, in the stands, and in your home
subHeadline: The NFL has partnered with AWS to implement a cloud-based data strategy that uses analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence to gain a deeper understanding of every aspect of the game and build a better football experience for fans, players, and teams.
description: From pre-season to post-season, the National Football League (NFL) delivers fans a thrilling, action-packed three hours with each game. Behind the nation’s most popular league is a philosophy of continuous improvement best expressed by legendary Miami Dolphins quarterback Dan Marino, who said, “You can do more, you can always do more.” One way the NFL does more is by pursuing innovative, data-driven programs to improve player safety, help players achieve their full potential, and make the game more exciting for fans. Since 2019, the League has partnered with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to implement a cloud-based data strategy that uses analytics, machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI) to gain a deeper understanding of every aspect of the game and build a better football experience for fans, players, and teams

The conversation delves into responsible AI practices, Onfido's innovative MLOps approach, and offers insights into the future of biometrics, as well as the importance of creating a culture of continuous learning.

Whether re-imagining business processes for efficiency and cost saving, or developing new products, services, or business models, it really comes down to creating business value. Darren Hardman, VP & General Manager of AWS UK and Ireland explores how UK businesses overcome barriers to innovation, and celebrates four British organisations pushing boundaries and embracing innovation to deliver novel customer experience and value.

name: greenway-health-chief-product-and-technology-officer-david-cohen

description:
As Greenway Health’s Chief Product and Technology Officer, David Cohen’s mission is to help the organization become the leading software provider for doctors and other healthcare professionals in the ambulatory care market. That means changing how the entire company thinks about creating solutions for everything from virtual care to back-office operations. AWS spoke to David about Greenway’s new product development approach and how it helped them deliver a series of successful new products at breakneck speed.

headline: The Guardian Business Briefs
subHeadline: From tech to talent: expert advice for turning today's business challenges into wins
description:
In this column from the Guardian, enterprise strategists from Amazon Web Services (AWS), provide insights into common business challenges – from moving to the cloud to attracting and retaining diverse talent – and how to solve them.

name: hbr-pulse-survey-report-delivering-customer-focused-innovation
headline: Delivering Customer-Focused Innovation
subHeadline: by Harvard Business Review Analytic Services, sponsored by AWS
description:
The disruptions of 2020 have been a test for innovation capabilities. The organizations that seem to be handling this test best are those that let their customers drive their innovation efforts. They aim to solve their customers’ problems first, and that informs how they innovate. Learn more about what innovation leaders do differently in this survey of 585 business executives conducted by Harvard Business Review Analytic Services in association with AWS. 

Read more »

name: helping-french-organizations-successfully-transform
headline: Helping French Organizations Successfully Transform
subHeadline: by Christian Chevalier, Head of Sales, AWS France
description:
Successful digital transformation continues to challenge many French organizations. Christian Chevalier, Head of Sales, AWS France, shares his experiences for some of the more common pitfalls and how French leaders can avoid them.

Read more »

name: herve-coureil-cdo-schneider-electric-yt-3w-H-k3KKiA
headline: Interview with Hervé Coureil, Chief Digital Officer, Life Is On/Schneider Electric
subHeadline: A conversation with Hervé Coureil, Chief Digital Officer, Life Is On/Schneider Electric
description:
Hervé shares his thoughts on how to identify and nurture future leaders, ways to inspire teams to raise the bar, and the importance of transparency.

name: how-a-cloud-based-data-ecosystem-is-helping-3m-transform-the-healthcare-business
headline: How a cloud-based data ecosystem is helping 3M HIS transform the healthcare business
subHeadline: How can heathcare companies put data and machine learning at the core of their operations? Learn how 3M transformed into a data-driven organization to improve the patient care journey.
description: 3M Health Information Systems (3M HIS), one of the world’s largest providers of software solutions for the healthcare industry, exemplifies 3M Co.’s legendary culture of innovation. By combining the power of a cloud-based data ecosystem with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), 3M HIS is transforming physician workflows and laborious “back office” processes to help healthcare organizations streamline clinical documentation and billing, enhance security and compliance, and redesign the physician-patient experience.

name: how-ai-and-ml-are-helping-to-tackle-covid-19-yt-QI8Fk-39_q8
headline: How AI and ML are Helping to Tackle COVID-19
subHeadline: A conversation with Swami Sivasubramanian, VP of Machine Learning, AWS
description:
In these continually change times, it’s not surprising that AI and ML, widely recognized for its problem-solving and predictive prowess, have become an essential navigational tool for many organisations. During this session Swami Sivasubramanian, VP of Machine Learning at AWS, will share how customers are embracing machine learning and AI in the wake of COVID-19 to scale customer communications, increase agility and efficiency, and help get people back to work safely.

Watch now »

name: how-AI-reduces-hunger-and-food-waste
headline: How AI and the Cloud Help Reduce Hunger and Food Waste
subHeadline: How AI assists in the reduction of hunger.
description: See how Peak, an AI company, is helping FareShare, a food redistribution charity, provide millions of meals to vulnerable people by managing the food supply chain and more effectively predicting donations. Powered by the AWS cloud with Intel technologies.

name: how-amazon-defines-and-operationalizes-a-day-1-culture
headline: Elements of Amazon's Day 1 Culture
subHeadline: by Daniel Slater, Worldwide Lead, Culture of Innovation, AWS
description:
Amazon's "Day 1" mentality is a culture and an operating model that puts customers at the center of everything Amazon does. Retaining a "Day 1" mentality relies on maintaining a long-term focus, obsessing over customers, and bold innovation. 

Read more »

name: how-amazon-ec2-mac-instances-spurs-the-next-wave-of-app-innovation-wired-brand-lab
headline: How Amazon EC2 Mac Instances Spurs the Next Wave of App Innovation
subHeadline: For years at Flipboard, developers faced daily bottlenecks. Here's how they improved.
description: After facing years of obstacles in efficiently building new app versions for Mac OS, Flipboard developers decided to turn to AWS EC2 Mac instances, shortening their process from 20 minutes to only 5. This not only gave Flipboard developers the ability to build apps and run automated tests simultaneously, but also gave designers more freedom to innovate without slowing down core aspects of app development.

name: how-AWS-helps-customers-meet-their-security-risk-and-compliance-objectives
headline: How AWS helps Customers Meet their Security, Risk, and Compliance Objectives
subHeadline: A conversation with Hart Rossman, Director of Global Security Practice at AWS
description:
AWS Enterprise Strategist Clarke Rodgers spoke to Hart Rossman, Director of Global Security Practice at AWS about how his team within the Professional Services organization addresses urgent customer needs around security, risk, and compliance and how he builds his team to continually raise the bar for customer experience.

Watch Video

name: how-aws-nitro-reimagines-the-future-of-virtualization-wired-brand-lab
headline: How AWS Nitro Reimagines the Future of Virtualization
subHeadline: The robots are finally here in a big way
description: When AWS realized customer computation were outgrowing cloud virtualization's capabilities, engineers rebuilt it by creating custom, original silicon chips, pioneering a hybrid software and hardware model called the AWS Nitro System. Learn more about the evolution of the virtualization landscape.

name: how-data-literate-is-your-organization
headline: How Data-literate is Your Organization?
subHeadline: by CIO.com, Sponsored by AWS
description:
Evaluating your organization’s level of data literacy is the first step toward creating a fully data-driven corporate culture that empowers everyone to perform better.

Read more »

name: how-do-you-become-a-data-driven-organization
headline: How do you become a data-driven organization?
subHeadline: AWS is how.
description:
Data is more than an operational asset like factories, machinery, IP, and capital. Utilized correctly, data is an invaluable source of potential growth. The key is recognizing its inherent value, leveraging it intelligently, and creating a culture that embraces the power of being data-driven.

Read more »

name: how-do-you-measure-social-capital
headline: What Is Social Capital and How Do You Measure It?
subHeadline: A conversation with Michael Arena, Vice President of Talent & Development, AWS
description:
“Most organizations don’t suffer from a deficit of ideas. They just need to create more deliberate connections." says Michael Arena, VP Talent & Development AWS. Explore the concept of innovation and how it is achieved and maintained in an organization, especially in a remote environment. As the quote above suggests, it might not necessarily be the ideas, knowledge and capabilities – the human capital – that are lacking within organizations today, but the way in which workers come together to realize, collaborate and act on these ideas–the social capital.

Read more »

name: how-edge-computing-is-rewriting-the-rules-of-manufacturing
headline: How edge computing is rewriting the rules of manufacturing
subHeadline: The “Industrial Edge” enables a new paradigm for how things are made—the smart factory
description: Factories have used robots to drive operational efficiency since the 1990s, but the real revolution is just beginning. Today’s devices connect to the cloud, to their operators, and to one another using powerful machine learning to optimize operations.

name: how-executives-are-thinking-about-transformation-yt-ZSMdbeqmnN0
headline: How Executives are Thinking About Transformation
subHeadline: A conversation with AWS Enterprise Strategists Thomas Blood and Miriam McLemore
description:
What are the most challenging aspects of business transformation? After meeting with over 200 executives over the past year, Thomas Blood and Miriam McLemore compare notes on the trends they've observed and discuss the common threads they're seeing globally and across industries.

Watch now »

name: how-five-industries-use-ai-machine-learning-and-the-cloud-to-meet-their-sustainability-goals
headline: How five key industries use AI, machine learning and the cloud to meet their sustainability goals
subHeadline: Technology innovation is helping some of the largest producers of greenhouse gases to drastically cut emissions. Learn how they’re doing it.
description: Reducing carbon emissions usually comes down to achieving greater efficiency in the use of energy and materials. Improving efficiency requires detailed mapping and monitoring of very complex systems such as factories, electrical grids, HVAC systems and logistics routings. Increasingly, these environments are outfitted with sensors, and artificial intelligence excels at finding patterns in the huge amounts of data that these sensors collect, says Bratin Saha, vice president of machine learning services at Amazon.

name: how-french-leaders-can-address-the-cultural-challenges-of-transformation
headline: How French Leaders Can Address the Cultural Challenges of Transformation
subHeadline: by Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales, AWS France
description:
At this time of disruption, many business leaders are working to accelerate technology transformation within their organisations in order to create efficiencies and deliver new business value. But, across France, executives have found that change initiatives are stalling and the benefits are too slow to materialise. So what can boards do in response to this? Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales for AWS France, explains four key cultural strategies for change with lasting impact.

Read more »

name: how-german-organizations-can-turn-security-into-an-enabler
headline: How German Organizations can Turn Security into an Enabler
subHeadline: by Gerald Boyne, Head of Security Assurance, AWS DACH region
description:
Security is at the top of nearly every German organization's agenda. Gerald Boyne, Head of Security Assurance, explores how embedding security practices into the culture of your organization can help avoid the financial or operational drain - and turn it into an organizational enabler instead.

Read more »

name: how-iberian-organizations-are-becoming-data-driven

subHeadline: by Mattia Gamberoni, Head of Enterprise, AWS Iberia
description:
With organizations’ need for faster, data-driven decision making to adapt and meet customer needs, establishing a strategy to unleash your organizations data is even more pressing. Mattia Gamberoni, Head of Enterprise at AWS Iberia, discusses those organizations across Iberia that are leading the way and common challenges to look out for.

Read more »

name: how-iridium-navigates-global-leadership-challenges
headline: How Iridium Navigates Global Leadership Challenges
subHeadline: Insights from one of the world’s most innovative industries
description:
What leadership practices are top of mind for executives driving innovation in global organizations? Join Manjula Sriram, Chief Information Officer at Iridium, in conversation with Tom Soderstrom, Enterprise Strategist at AWS, about embracing mistakes, fostering experimentation, and the evolving landscape of technology in the space industry, including AI and IoT.

subHeadline: Examining the value Live Nation realized from migrating to the cloud
description:
Live Nation produces more concerts, sells more tickets, and connects more brands to music than anyone else in the world. Jake Burns, VP of Cloud Services for Live Nation, worked with the AWS Cloud Economics team to understand the value Live Nation realized from their migration to the cloud. Together, they identified four key areas of quantifiable business value.

Read more »

name: how-mcgraw-hills-bold-innovation-is-transforming-the-way-students-learn
headline: A conversation with McGraw Hill Chief Transformation and Strategy Officer, Justin Singh
description:
Get a behind-the-scenes view of how McGraw Hill’s multi-year innovation journey helped them grow their digital billings by 20% in 2022, serve more than one million learners with their application, Sharpen, and positions them to boldly respond to their customers’ future needs.

Watch now

headline: How Netflix Thinks About Cybersecurity
subHeadline: A conversation with Jason Chan, VP of Information Security, Netflix
description:
In the first episode of "Verified: Presented by AWS re:Inforce," Steve Schmidt, Chief Information Security Officer for AWS, sits down with Jason Chan, VP of Information Security at Netflix, to talk security strategy, building a security program, Zero Trust Access and cats as a unique threat model.

Watch now »

name: how-one-healthcare-startup-is-making-data-work-for-doctors-and-patients
headline: How one healthcare startup is making data work for doctors and patients
subHeadline: Navina is using AI to make data work for physicians, not against them, leveraging the full AWS toolkit to improve the human-to-human interactions at the heart of healthcare.
description: Healthcare is deeply human, and each successful doctor-patient interaction is unique. Some patients feel the most reassured by a straight-forward physician in a white coat; others respond better to a warm and humorous bedside manner. But if there’s one thing nobody wants their doctor to be, it’s overwhelmed. In addition to the detrimental effects on the doctors themselves, rampant burnout among healthcare providers puts patients at risk.

name: how-organizational-learning-can-unlock-more-business-value-from-machine-learning
headline: How organizational learning can unlock more business value from machine learning
subHeadline: Learn how AWS customers have maximized the business value of their AI investments.
description: We routinely underestimate the effects that new technology has in the long run while also overestimating its impact in the short term. What has become known as Amara’s Law, in honor of the late researcher and scientist Roy Amara, is playing out now in many organizations that adopt artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) technologies. AI/ML has capabilities that seemed science fiction not long ago, from autonomous driving to image recognition and advanced robotics, with surely many more on the way. At the same time, even advanced enterprises can struggle to achieve the anticipated return on their AI/ML investments. Although expectations might have been set high, following several guidelines has helped our customers maximize the business value delivered by their AI/ML initiatives. We’ll share them in this AI/ML blog post mini-series.

name: how-the-cio-can-help-support-environmental-sustainability
headline: How the CIO Can Help Support Environmental Sustainability
subHeadline: By Mark Schwartz, AWS Enterprise Strategist
description:
The CIO plays a larger role in environmental sustainability than most people realize. Thinking of the CIO merely as a technology leader has led many to focus on the CIO’s role in reducing just the IT infrastructure’s carbon footprint. But given the CIO’s role as an executive with a seat at the company’s strategic table, the possibilities go much further. I’ll take these two areas one at a time.
 
Read More

name: how-to-build-a-successful-security-culture-yt-HC2S7VKh2VY
headline: How to Build a Successful Security Culture
subHeadline: A conversation with Steve Schmidt, VP of Security Engineering and CISO, AWS
description:
Building a security culture starts in the C-suite. While this is championed by the CISO, every business and technical leader has a role in communicating and practicing good security behavior across their teams. Steve Schmidt, CISO for AWS Security, shares his best practices and approaches for driving the right behaviors related to proactive security posture, the impact security has on the bottom line, and a plan of action that every executive should have when partnering with their security teams.

Read more »

headline: How to Hire and Develop Security Assurance Talent
subHeadline: A conversation with Jessie Skibbe, Senior Practice Manager of AWS Security Assurance

name: how-to-position-your-organization-for-the-future-by-building-a-more-resilient-business-video-page
headline: How to Position Your Organization for the Future by Building a More Resilient Business
subHeadline: A conversation with AWS Enterprise Strategists Tom Godden, Phil Le-Brun, and Miriam McLemore
description:
Resilient organizations can absorb a crisis, often recovering faster and emerging stronger than others. Those that innovate during turbulent times are building market value and competitive advantage versus those that wait for conditions to improve. Join AWS Enterprise Strategists Tom Godden, Phil Le-Brun, and Miriam McLemore, as they discuss how to build an enterprise that can thrive in challenging seasons.

Watch now

name: how-to-successfully-scale-your-talent-transformation-yt-pdz2mjX0htc
headline: How to Successfully Scale Your Talent Transformation
subHeadline: with Jonathan Allen, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
In this video, Jonathan Allen sets out the 12 steps to successfully scale your talent when moving to the cloud. One of the most important steps is upskilling existing employees, and Jonathan tells us how getting just 10% of your team certified could make a company-wide difference.

Watch now »

name: how-to-think-like-a-digital-cfo
headline: How to Think Like a Digital CFO
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
As we navigate the changes brought about by the digital revolution, we see the role of the enterprise CFO changing. In fact, the digital world requires us to think very differently about what a CFO does. In this ebook, AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz compares the “old” and the “new” ways of defining what a CFO does in order to identify the traits of today's digital CFO. Though different CFOs and their enterprises have treated the role differently, it’s clear that the CFO has become central to driving the digital performance of the enterprise.

Read more »

name: how-to-think-like-a-startup
headline: How to Think Like a Startup
subHeadline: A conversation with Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
description:
Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy at AWS, talks with Kylie Bonassi, Director of Brand Communication at ADAPT, about how any organisation can learn from startups on how to innovate. 

Watch now »

name: how-to-use-real-time-data-to-make-better-faster-decisions
headline: How to use real-time data to make better, faster decisions
subHeadline: With so much diverse data available, why do so many companies still struggle to embrace the real-time, data-driven decision-making they need to be more agile? One thing is clear: The challenge isn’t solved by technology alone.
description: With so much diverse data available, why do so many companies still struggle to embrace the real-time, data-driven decision-making they need to be more agile? One thing is clear: The challenge isn’t solved by technology alone. “You can’t buy transformation,” says Tom Godden, Principal Technical Evangelist with the Enterprise Strategy team at AWS. “Real change doesn’t come just from new technology—it comes from rethinking your processes, which are enabled by the technology.”

name: how-trellix-is-staying-at-the-forefront-of-security-video-page
headline: How Trellix is Staying at the Forefront of Security
subHeadline: A conversation with Martin Holste, CTO for Cloud at Trellix
description:
As the CTO for Cloud at Trellix, Martin Holste has deep expertise in cloud security strategy. With his additional background in machine learning and managing a Security Operations Center (SOC), there’s no one better positioned to speak on trending security issues such as generative AI, Zero Trust, and Multi-cloud management. Hear about all these issues and more in this Security Leaders interview.

Watch now

name: how-volkswagen-drives-enterprise-wide-change-by-articulating-a-bold-vision
headline: How Volkswagen is Transforming its Global Manufacturing on the Cloud
subHeadline: A conversation with Volkswagen’s Nihar Patel, Executive Vice President for New Business Development, and Frank Goeller, Head of Digital Production
description:
The Volkswagen Group manufactures 11 million cars a year and brings 200 million parts a day into its factories—a massive scale at which to operate a global supply chain which does not have processes and systems that are standardized across the network. Volkswagen is working with AWS to move its 124 factory sites to a single architecture, the Volkswagen Industrial Cloud, which will bring huge efficiencies to its automotive manufacturing and logistics processes. But the program requires enormous changes to systems, processes, and jobs.

In this conversation, Volkswagen’s Nihar Patel, executive vice president for new business development, and Frank Goeller, head of digital production, talk about how they are redesigning technology and processes, scaling them up across the network, and driving cost efficiencies. They describe how they are motivating employees to contribute by training and investing in them, and communicating what the future will look like. AWS’s Douglas Bellin, business development executive for Industrie 4.0 & Smart Factory, weighs in to explain how AWS is helping Volkswagen scale their technology across 124 plants.

Read more »

name: how-we-learned-to-break-down-barriers-to-machine-learning
headline: How we learned to break down barriers to machine learning
subHeadline: Dr. Nashlie Sephus schools Ars Technica on how to get machine learning on your IT team's radar.
description: Access is the biggest barrier to the greater use of AI/ML—in a lot of ways, it's another wrinkle in the old problem of the digital divide. A core component of being able to utilize most common AI/ML tools is having reliable and fast Internet access, and drawing on experience from her background, Dr. Sephus pointed out that a lack of access to technology in primary schools in poorer areas of the country sets kids on a path away from being able to use the kinds of tools we're talking about. Furthermore, lack of early access leads to resistance to technology later in life.

name: how-wiz-a-6-billion-unicorn-uses-specialized-data-tools-to-fuel-innovation-and-growth
headline: How Wiz, a $6 Billion Unicorn, Uses Specialized Data Tools to Fuel Innovation and Growth
subHeadline: In today's complicated landscape, startups need to understand what part of their data model is meaningful and empower teams with the right data tools. Learn how startups can extract more value from their data to create new products and speed innovation.
description: Cloud security company Wiz, a unicorn with a valuation of $6 billion, recently announced that it had reached annual recurring revenue of $100 million—only 18 months after launching its first product. Wiz achieved this growth by providing easy-to-use tools that help organizations quickly identify prioritize, remediate, and stave off potential cyberattacks.

name: humility
headline: Humility
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
In the digital world, we are willing to be surprised and to learn. In the old days, we relied on a plan, prepared in advance, to guide our activities. But in a world dominated by uncertainty, in a world in which none of us knows all there is to know about our customers or about what will change in our competitive or regulatory environment, how can someone presume to develop a plan that will deliver business value? AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz shares his thoughts on why humility is the essence of digital transformation.

Read more »

name: identifying-and-selecting-future-leaders-yt-C7eaipZjrgg

subHeadline: A conversation with Charlie Ewen, Chief Information Officer, Met Office

Charlie describes the talent strategy and leadership development program at Met Office, including the value of using exemplars as a mechanism for inspiring teams across vastly different functional domains.

headline: How cloud stimulates growth and customer satisfaction
subHeadline: A conversation with Frank Tarsillo, SVP and Chief Architect at IHS Markit
description: Frank Tarsillo is well-known and respected as a technology leader and change agent. In this Spotlight, we will dive into real-world examples of how the Cloud can benefit an organization and its customers to stimulate growth within the company and customer satisfaction.

name: impact-of-aws-in-the-uk
headline: The Impact of AWS in the UK
subHeadline: by Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager, AWS UK and Ireland
description:
With Cloud computing, the pervasive technology of the digital age, at the core of so many fast-growing UK business, Darren Hardman—VP, General Manager, UK and Ireland for AWS—investigates the impact of AWS on the UK.

headline: In New Poll, CFOs Say Culture and Training Issues Blocking Digital Efforts
subHeadline: by StrategicCFO360,  Sponsored by AWS
description:
Nearly 90 percent of those surveyed said culture and training—not technology—is the biggest challenge to building greater agility in their companies. To win, “they need to un-become some of what they are.”

headline: Ignite Innovation with a Culture of Inclusion
subHeadline: A Mature Approach to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Delivers Real Results
description: Organizations that invest in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) programs are seeing positive business outcomes such as better competitive position, increased agility/innovativeness, and better brand perception.

name: inclusive-mental-models-empowering-your-employees-article
headline: Inclusive Mental Models: Empowering Your Employees
subHeadline: by Daryl Hammett General Manager, Global Demand, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning & Operations, Amazon Web Services (AWS)
description:
Innovation is accelerated when employees feel truly included. AWS Global AI/ML Program Manager Daryl Hammett says true inclusion isn't about inviting employees to contribute; it's when they feel empowered to contribute without having to be asked. Read this article to learn tips to create a truly inclusive work culture.

Read now

name: infor
headline: How Infor builds the future of industry enterprise cloud applications using AWS
subHeadline: A conversation with Kevin Samuelson, CEO and the executive leadership team at Infor
description:
Hear from Infor's executive team on how their strategic partnership with AWS provides enterprise customers with a sustainable operational advantage across multiple industries. 

Read more »

name: infor-cco-nancy-mattenberger-and-cro-rod-johnson
headline: Exceeding Customer Expectations with a Common Culture
subHeadline: A conversation with Rod Johnson, Global President and Chief Revenue Officer, and Nancy Mattenberger, Global Chief Customer Officer, Infor
description:
Infor executives, Rod Johnson and Nancy Mattenberger, and Amazon share a common goal: making customers happy. As one of the largest ERP companies operating on AWS, Infor can focus on what it does best—develop cloud-based, industry-specific software for core business processes—without worrying about scalability, resilience, or security. Nancy and Rod discussed how Infor puts the customer front and center in everything it does, from the company’s industry focus and leadership model to its deployment strategy and innovation frameworks. 

Read more »

name: infor-ceo-kevin-samuelson-and-cto-soma-somasundaram
headline: How Infor Leverages Data to Improve Business Outcomes
subHeadline: A conversation with Kevin Samuelson, CEO, and Soma Somasundaram, Chief Technology Officer and President of Products, Infor
description:
Kevin Samuelson, Infor CEO, and Soma Somasundaram, CTO and President of Products, joined Infor when it was founded in 2002 to build industry-specific software helping businesses better run their core operations. Along the way, Infor’s partnership with AWS has been critical to helping them give customers greater access to the data they need to stay ahead in a changing market. In this conversation, Kevin and Soma share how they use and analyze data in the AWS Cloud to continually improve their software solutions for customers. 

Read more »

name: infor-cmo-amanda-jobbins
headline: Attracting Customers with New Digital Experiences
subHeadline: A conversation with Amanda Jobbins, Chief Marketing Officer, Infor
description:
Amanda Jobbins has spent her career marketing software solutions for some of the world’s largest technology companies. Since joining Infor as its Chief Marketing Officer in the fall of 2020, Amanda has been exploring new ways to get the organization’s industry-specific cloud solutions in front of more customers. Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist for AWS, spoke with Amanda about how she plans to do that. 

Read more »

name: innovate-to-increase-accessibility-and-inclusion
headline: Innovate to Increase Accessibility and Inclusion
subHeadline: The cloud helps create better experiences for everyone.
description: The number of people over 65 is expected to more than double over the next 30 years, and aging is one of the leading causes of hearing loss in adults. In fact, the WHO estimates by 2050, 10% of the world’s population will have disabling hearing loss. Digital solutions can play an important role in improving communications accessibility for people with hearing loss. For example, with an automatic speech recognition service, organizations can easily add speech-to-text capabilities to their applications, including the ability to attribute text to different speakers in a conversation. A leading AWS customer in the intelligence community has used speech recognition technology to add live captioning to its video teleconferencing solution.

name: innovating-through-disruption
headline: Innovating Through Disruption
subHeadline: by Richard Halkett, AWS Worldwide Lead, Digital Innovation
description:
More than ever, companies are beset by challenges–and surrounded by opportunities, too. To thrive, companies are going to have to do (even) more with (even) less. Amazon’s approach to innovation is one way of tackling the challenge, and it could have elements helpful to others in the present climate. In our experience, innovating successfully depends on rapidly determining where to innovate, what solution to focus on, and how to build. 

Read more »

name: innovating-to-remove-barriers-in-the-fertility-journey
headline: Innovating to Remove Barriers in the Fertility Journey
subHeadline: A conversation with Joy Lewin, Senior Director of Commercial Development and Strategic Accounts at Ferring Pharmaceuticals
description:
As the Senior Director of Commercial Development and Strategic Accounts at Ferring Pharmaceuticals, Joy Lewin is trying to help couples take the first step in their fertility journey. One in eight U.S. couples is infertile, which amounts to 6.5 million Americans of reproductive age. Of those, 2.2 million people are actively trying to get pregnant. Some seek fertility help from their family doctor or OB-GYN and others make appointments at fertility clinics. About 800K will get pregnant. That still leaves 1.4 million people who could benefit from treatment but, in reality, only about 150K access it. AWS enterprise strategist Miriam McLemore spoke to Joy about how Ferring is innovating to help those 1.3 million people create the family of their dreams.

Read more »

name: innovation-at-the-edge
headline: Innovation at the Edge
subHeadline: In today's global economy, fortune favors businesses that can bring services and experiences to their customers quickly, while focusing on flexibility and agility to continuously improve.
description: For companies large and small, operating in the cloud is nothing new. But today’s most successful companies are taking their operations further by bringing the cloud closer to both themselves and their customers with hybrid cloud and edge computing. This new mindset cuts latency to the quick, creates lightning-fast information processing, and offers unprecedented flexibility, both for companies and their customers. The results involve everything from autonomous vehicles, to smart factories, to an edge that extends all the way to low-earth orbit.

name: innovation-with-hybrid-and-edge
headline: Digital transformation at the edge
subHeadline: Today’s businesses need hybrid cloud and edge computing to keep up with the technological shift that is transforming how global operations are run and how information is shared
description: Businesses across the globe need the agility to bring services and experiences to their customers quickly while being flexible enough to continuously iterate and improve on their products and services. To produce this digital transformation, organizations need to bring the cloud closer to their data or their end users. Hybrid cloud and edge technologies seamlessly extend the cloud to where companies need it, regardless of where the data resides. Amazon Web Services (AWS) brings years of cloud experience for seamless and secure hybrid and edge experiences — whether that’s in the cloud, at a data center, a large metropolitan area, at a 5G network, a smart factory or building, or beyond

name: innovation-with-hybrid-and-edge-balancing-act

description: As business and IT leaders make decisions about how they develop and deliver digitally enabled experiences to meet consumer expectations, they must also consider the future trajectory of economic, regulatory and environmental forces that can impact their ability to meet consumer demands and their business implications. This article identifies three trends that have altered the course of CX digitalization and provides an outlook of how external forces will continue to impact business and tech strategies in the future.

name: blog-it-and-environmental-social-and-corporate-governance-esg-part-one-a-ceo-and-board-concern
headline: IT and Environmental, Social, and Corporate Governance (ESG), Part One: A CEO and Board Concern
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
Environmental and social governance, or ESG, is a growing concern for business leaders—and for government regulators, investors, and standards bodies. Recent events have only increased the business world’s focus on ESG: worker wellness has become a major concern during the COVID-19 pandemic; social justice protests have drawn attention to gaps in diversity, equity, and inclusion; and the impacts of climate change and the importance of environmental sustainability are becoming harder, if not impossible, to ignore. It’s time that IT organizations and digital technologists recognized the role they can and must play in supporting their companies’ ESG efforts.

Read more »

name: blog-it-and-esg-part-two-how-it-can-and-must-further-the-companys-esg-efforts
headline: IT and ESG Part Two: How IT Can and Must Further the Company’s ESG Efforts
subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
description:
In my previous post I explained why environmental, social, and corporate governance (or ESG) has become such an important concern for enterprises; why it is a strategic consideration; why it rises to the level of the board of directors’ attention; and how it differs from corporate social responsibility (CSR) in that it requires the company’s deliberate and rational effort to ingrain social responsibility throughout its processes and to deliver accountability and transparency to stakeholders. I believe that IT and digital technology play a major role in delivering on ESG initiatives.

Read more »

That’s precisely what Chris Thomas, Managing Director of Technology and Innovation in the Moody’s Analytics Accelerator did after Moody’s acquired REIS, a U.S. commercial real estate data provider. As the technology lead of Moody’s Analytics Accelerator, Thomas’s role is to support new product development and integration of acquisitions, making sure that technologies are aligned effectively. Jeff Drew from AWS spoke with Thomas about how REIS and the Moody’s Analytics Accelerator met their integration goals and what learnings were derived that could benefit future acquisitions.

For an industry that relied less than a generation ago on DVDs and cable, this transformation has been profound. And it could not have happened in the same way, or as quickly, without the cloud.
